references.paper_title: Neural networks and physical systems with emergent collective computational abilities
references.reason: This paper introduces the Hopfield network, a foundational model for associative memory, upon which many subsequent models, including the ones discussed in this paper, are based.

references.paper_title: Dense associative memory for pattern recognition
references.reason: This work introduces Dense Associative Memories (DenseAMs), a high-capacity variant of Hopfield networks that addresses limitations in traditional Hopfield networks, directly relevant to the focus of this paper.

references.paper_title: Random features for large-scale kernel machines
references.reason: This highly influential paper introduces the use of random features to approximate kernel methods efficiently, a technique leveraged in this paper to create a distributed representation for DenseAMs.
This paper introduces a novel random feature approach with improved approximation accuracy and efficiency, techniques that are applied and extended upon in this paper for DenseAMs.

references.paper_title: Kernel memory networks: A unifying framework for memory modeling
references.reason: This paper connects kernel methods and associative memory models, establishing a theoretical link that is relevant to the core idea of this paper to represent DenseAMs using kernel methods.
